text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/158ea175a99fc23eae1b0a5ee9a81cdd973854a6|patch 8.2.1000: get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual>
patch 8.2.1000: get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual

Problem:    Get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual and a CmdLineEnter
            autocommand was used.
Solution:   Reset ex_pressedreturn. (closes #6293)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1000: get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual · vim/vim@158ea17
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1000: get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual · vim/vim@158ea17
attachments.text: Problem: Get error when leaving Ex mode with :visual and a CmdLineEnter autocommand was used. Solution: Reset ex_pressedreturn. (closes #6293)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/72abcf42d4b28719863c3bdf72b4c05d147a7d83|patch 8.2.1001: Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment>
patch 8.2.1001: Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment

Problem:    Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment.
Solution:   Skip more of the assignment.  Do not set ctx_skip when code is
            reachable.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1001: Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment · vim/vim@72abcf4
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1001: Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment · vim/vim@72abcf4
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash with nested "if" and assignment. Solution: Skip more of the assignment. Do not set ctx_skip when code is reachable.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ceb2e7751089bd417c6250d63e28616483b5796b|patch 8.2.1002: test may fail when run directly>
patch 8.2.1002: test may fail when run directly

Problem:    Test may fail when run directly.
Solution:   Check if g:run_nr exists. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6285)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1002: test may fail when run directly · vim/vim@ceb2e77
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1002: test may fail when run directly · vim/vim@ceb2e77
attachments.text: Problem: Test may fail when run directly. Solution: Check if g:run_nr exists. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6285)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/865af6b990f058fab10c9ff10c77eb0e3bd48ad5|patch 8.2.1003: Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic>
patch 8.2.1003: Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic

Problem:    Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic.
Solution:   Get type from the first argument. (closes #6292)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1003: Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic · vim/vim@865af6b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1003: Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic · vim/vim@865af6b
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: return type of sort() is too generic. Solution: Get type from the first argument. (closes #6292)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/511feec6f0a9e954f1d7353425fa51232b1a8e88|patch 8.2.1004: line numbers below filler lines not always updated>
patch 8.2.1004: line numbers below filler lines not always updated

Problem:    Line numbers below filler lines not always updated.
Solution:   Don't break out of the win_line() loop too early. (Christian
            Brabandt, closes #6294, closes #6138)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1004: line numbers below filler lines not always updated · vim/vim@511feec
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1004: line numbers below filler lines not always updated · vim/vim@511feec
attachments.text: Problem: Line numbers below filler lines not always updated. Solution: Don't break out of the win_line() loop too early. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6294, closes #6138)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9b68c82b7ca768100f3eb4223d100c62c5429e53|patch 8.2.1005: Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing>
patch 8.2.1005: Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing

Problem:    Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing.
Solution:   Use an enum value.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1005: Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing · vim/vim@9b68c82
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1005: Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing · vim/vim@9b68c82
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using TRUE/FALSE/MAYBE for ctx_skip is confusing. Solution: Use an enum value.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c8cb883015619cfe6db931ac2d6e15b0be5c56ed|patch 8.2.1007: completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !">
patch 8.2.1007: completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !"

Problem:    Completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !".
Solution:   Skip over "++arg". (Christian Brabandt, closes #6275,
            closes #6258)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1007: completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !" · vim/vim@c8cb883
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1007: completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !" · vim/vim@c8cb883
attachments.text: Problem: Completion doesn't work after ":r ++arg !". Solution: Skip over "++arg". (Christian Brabandt, closes #6275, closes #6258)
